question:
You live in an English speaking country and you want to do some voluntary, unpaid work in a developing country. Write a letter to a company called Cultural Expeditions, which organizes such trips. In your letter:
Explain why you want to do the voluntary work.
State what your skills and experience are.
Indicate where you would like to volunteer and for how long.
text: I am Kunal Talreja, residing in London. As you know, summer vacations are drawing closer and I am planning to spend those two months helping and contributing to society. I am writing this letter to express my desire to volunteer as an English teacher in one of the developing countries.

Let me give you brief details about my skills and experience. I am holding a bachelor's degree in English literature and currently pursuing my master's in English and I have been working as an English teacher at a public school for eight years. Last year I volunteered to teach English in one of the remote villages in Thailand.

After seeing your advertisement, I searched online about your programs and I would like to volunteer in any of the African countries. Let me know if there are any opportunities available. If that is not possible, I am willing to go to any other country. I am available from the start of May until the end of June.
Thank you for your time and consideration.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
